name: Comprehensive Counterfactual & Temporal
description: Tests what-if scenarios, temporal ordering, and hypothetical reasoning

theory.natural_language: Physical facts: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level. Ice melts at 0 degrees. Room temperature is about 20 degrees. Water is liquid between 0 and 100 degrees. Humans need water to survive. Fire requires oxygen to burn. Gravity pulls objects down. Metal expands when heated. Temporal facts: World War 1 happened before World War 2. The Renaissance came before the Industrial Revolution. The Internet was invented after television. Smartphones came after personal computers. Process sequences: Design comes before manufacturing. Testing comes after development. Planning is required before execution. Approval is needed before implementation.

queries.natural_language: If water boiled at 50 degrees, would it still be liquid at room temperature?

expected_answer.natural_language: No, if water boiled at 50 degrees and room temperature is 20 degrees, water would still be liquid. But if room temp was above 50, it would be gas.
expected_answer.explanation: 20 < 50, so water stays liquid at room temp

queries.natural_language: What if there was no oxygen? Could fire exist?

expected_answer.natural_language: No, fire requires oxygen to burn. Without oxygen, fire cannot exist.

queries.natural_language: Did World War 1 happen before World War 2?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, World War 1 happened before World War 2.

queries.natural_language: Did smartphones exist before personal computers?

expected_answer.natural_language: No, smartphones came after personal computers.
